frameDefinitions: The adjectives and nouns in this frame describe an Experiencer who is feeling or experiencing a particular emotional response to a Stimulus or about a Topic.
A Helper benefits a Benefited_party by enabling the culmination of a Goal that the Benefited_party has.
A Benefactor confers a Beneficial_situation to a Beneficiary.
A Supplier gives a Theme to a Recipient to fulfill a need or purpose (Imposed_purpose) of the Recipient.
A Donor transfers a Theme from a Donor to a Recipient.
An Entity aids in the successful completion of a Purpose.
frameExamples: Mr. Whiskers is <t>upset</t> that there are no more cat treats.
Will you <t>help</t> the Government find your brother?
His presence at the summit did not <t>BENEFIT</t> diplomatic relations in the slightest.
Habituating the ground nesting chimp groups is done by <t>provisioning</t> them with sugar cane. CNI INI
A box is an <t>ideal</t> storage device.
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Experiencer</fen> is the person or sentient entity that experiences or feels the emotions.
The <fen>Topic</fen> is the general area in which the emotion occurs.  It indicates a range of possible <fen>Stimulus</fen>.
The <fen>Stimulus</fen> is the person, event, or state of affairs that evokes the emotional response in the <fen>Experiencer</fen>.

The Frame Element <fen>Expressor</fen> marks expressions that indicate a body part, gesture or other expression of the <fen>Experiencer</fen> that reflects his or her emotional state.  They describe a presentation of the experience or emotion denoted by the adjective or noun.
The <fen>State</fen> is the abstract noun that describes a more lasting experience by the <fen>Experiencer</fen>.
The <fen>Event</fen> is the occasion or happening that <fen>Experiencer</fen>s in a certain emotional state participate in.
The <fen>Benefited_party</fen> receives a benefit from the action of the <fen>Helper</fen>.
The <fen>Helper</fen> performs some action that benefits the <fen>Benefited_party</fen>.
The desirable state of affairs that the <fen>Benefited_party</fen> is involved in and which is enabled by the <fen>Helper</fen>.
This role identifies a <fen>Focal_entity</fen> involved in achieving the <fen>Goal</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the Assistance occurs.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the Assistance occurs.
The <fen>Benefactor</fen> is the person or thing that gives an advantage to the <fen>Beneficiary</fen>.
The <fen>Beneficiary</fen> is person or thing that receives an advantage from the <fen>Benefactor</fen>.

The <fen>Beneficial_situation</fen> is the item or action that is given to or done for the <fen>Beneficiary</fen> by the <fen>Benefactor</fen>.  A change of possession can, but does not have to occur.
The person that begins in possession of the <fen>Theme</fen> and causes it to be in the possession of the <fen>Recipient</fen>.
The entity that ends up in possession of the <fen>Theme</fen>.
The object that is given to the <fen>Recipient</fen> .
The <fen>Recipient</fen>'s intended purpose for the <fen>Theme</fen>.
The <fen>Time</fen> is when the <fen>Supplier</fen> gives the <fen>Theme</fen> to the <fen>Recipient</fen>.
The <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Supplier</fen> gives the <fen>Theme</fen> to the <fen>Recipient</fen>.
The person that begins in possession of the <fen>Theme</fen> and causes it to be in the possession of the <fen>Recipient</fen> .
The entity that ends up in possession of the <fen>Theme</fen>.
The object that changes ownership.
The <fen>Time</fen> is when the <fen>Donor</fen> gives the <fen>Theme</fen> to the <fen>Recipient</fen>.
The <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Donor</fen> gives the <fen>Theme</fen> to the <fen>Recipient</fen>.
The item which is useful for some purpose.
The kind of task which is promoted by the use or presence of the <fen>Entity</fen>.
When the <fen>Entity</fen> is useful for a <fen>Purpose</fen>.
listRoleExamples: Nan Ho turned, <fex>his</fex> extreme agitation unnoticed by the Prince.
Liz's anger <fex>towards Raquel</fex> dates back to a charity dinner this year.
'Can I help you?' she asked, trying not to let him see the amusement <fex>in her blue eyes</fex>.
The end of the film was filled with jubilant <fex>scenes</fex>.
Whoever didn't cook has to help <fex>with the dishes</fex>.
The police assisted Harry in finding his cat <fex>on Wednesday afternoon</fex>.
The police assisted Harry in finding his cat <fex>in front of his house</fex>.
I approve of <fex>your</fex> having supplied him with a file of soldiers.
VESID also supplied <fex>him</fex> with an all zone bus pass to help him travel to interviews.

Cromwell merged men from multiple regiments into a single one and provisioned
them <fex>with red uniforms</fex> to replace their former regiment colors.
God gave them the promise of victory and equipped them <fex>for the battle</fex>.
In Breidbach, water tankers were <fex>yesterday</fex> supplied to the community as the main water supply pipe had been washed away.

The Harpley was launched in Launceston on the 2nd February, 1847, and with the exception
of her chain cables, was <fex>there</fex> supplied with all her materials and stores.
